intro: Jonorchis, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their intricate, often showy flowers that typically feature three sepals and three petals, with one of the petals modified into a lip. Jonorchis species are native to various regions, primarily in tropical and subtropical areas of the Americas. They thrive in humid environments and require well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The genus includes several species that are popular among orchid enthusiasts for their ornamental value and unique floral structures.
